thread.title: 5 things to do this weekend in the Peoria area
thread.title_full: 5 things to do this weekend in the Peoria area

author: Staff
title: 5 things to do this weekend in the Peoria area
text: 5 things to do this weekend in the Peoria area Looking for some fun this weekend? A few suggestions... Comment Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 2:35 PM Updated at 3:35 PM Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 2:35 PM Updated at 3:35 PM 1 “The Rocky Horror Picture Show ” will be presented at midnight Friday and Saturday at Peoria Players Theatre , 4300 N. University St. Doors open at 11:30 p.m. Tickets are $15. 2 “ Tween Stars Live ,” featuring five of the biggest Disney and Nickelodeon stars, will be at 2 p.m. Saturday at the Peoria Civic Center Theater. Tickets are $21-$62. 3 Pumpkin Bash will be from 11 a.m.-2 p.m. Saturday at the Peoria Zoo , Glen Oak Park. Event includes a mini trick-or-treat trail, games, crafts, and spooky decorations. Cost is regular zoo admission of $6/children ages 2-12; $9/adults; $8/seniors and active military. Zoo admission also includes free admission to Luthy Botanical Garden with its Hogwarts Garden of Botanical Wonders. 4 Wildlife Scary Park will be Friday through Sunday at Wildlife Prairie Park, Hanna City. Event includes a haunted train ride, trick-or-treat trail and a hayrack ride. Hours: 5-9 p.m. Oct. 23-24 and 4-8 p.m. Oct. 25. Admission: $10/nonmembers; $8/members. Call 676-0998. 5 Spook Hollow with M.C. Manor & M.C. Nightmare featuring three horrifying events for one admission price, Friday and Saturday in Marquette Heights. Admission: $25 and $40 for a speed pass to avoid long lines. Visit http://spookhollow.ticketleap.com/2015/ and at the gate from 6:30 p.m.-11 p.m. Gate opens at 7 p.m. Event is located off Interstate I-474 Exit 9, look for the search light (613 LaSalle Blvd., Marquette Heights). By Staff
